ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Neurofibromatosis type 2 (NF2) with Bilateral Vestibular Schwannomas
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: MRI confirmed bilateral masses consistent with vestibular schwannomas; history of bilateral hearing loss.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral Profound Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiometry showed no response to pure-tone signals at equipment limits; SAT 100 dB HL in left ear only.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral Vestibular Hypofunction
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: VNG and cVEMPs revealed absent responses bilaterally.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess degree and configuration of hearing loss.
To determine speech awareness thresholds given profound loss.
To evaluate for retrocochlear lesions given sudden loss and history of VS.
To evaluate aided performance for CI candidacy (HINT).
To assess vestibular function given reports of imbalance and bilateral pathology.
To assess motivation, expectations, and mental health suitability for CI.
To monitor tumor growth and internal device status at long-term follow-up.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial audiometric testing revealed bilateral profound SNHL. MRI confirmed bilateral vestibular schwannomas consistent with NF2.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral profound SNHL; no response at limits.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Left SAT 100 dB HL; Right No Response.

tests.name: Diagnostic Imaging (MRI)
tests.result_summary: Bilateral vestibular schwannomas; Left 1.8 cm (filling IAC), Right 4.4 mm (intracanalicular).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Candidacy evaluation confirmed poor aided benefit and bilateral vestibular hypofunction. Psychological assessment cleared patient for surgery.

tests.name: Vestibular Assessment
tests.result_summary: Absent cVEMPs bilaterally; no measurable caloric responses (bilateral hypofunction).

tests.name: Psychological assessment
tests.result_summary: Minimal risk of depression; realistic expectations; appropriate motivation.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Successful implantation of right ear. No neural response on NRT, but placement confirmed.
Early post-activation showed significant improvement in speech recognition despite lack of NRT.

tests.name: Speech recognition (HINT)
tests.result_summary: Improved to 88% in quiet within several months.

tests.name: Mapping
tests.result_summary: Stable impedances; normal morphology on AutoNRT (later).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Long-term follow-up showed sustained benefit and no tumor growth.

tests.name: Speech recognition (AzBio)
tests.result_summary: 81% in quiet; 37% in noise (+10 dB SNR).

proposed_items: Observational approach to monitor tumor growth
counseling_actions: Discuss realistic expectations regarding speech recognition due to 35-year auditory deprivation in the right ear.
Explain that the left ear is not a CI candidate due to large tumor size.
Advise that tumor growth could impact CI function or require explantation.
Clarify that ABI is not considered as tumor removal is not planned.
Counsel on the risks of surgery and potential for limited benefit.

escalation.destination: Skull base tumor team (neurotology, neurosurgery, radiation oncology)
escalation.rationale_short: To review options regarding tumor treatment (observation vs surgery/radiation) and clearance for auditory rehabilitation.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor tumor growth via MRI/CT and assess CI performance and mapping needs.

expected_outcome: Intraoperative neural response telemetry (NRT): No measurable response.
Aided sound-field thresholds: Improved to 20-25 dB HL with CI.
HINT sentences in quiet (several months post-activation): 88%.
AzBio sentences in noise (+10 dB SNR) (5-year follow-up): 37%.
Computed tomographic (CT) scan (5-year follow-up): No tumor growth demonstrated.
Patient achieved significant open-set word recognition, improved voice modulation, and effective telephone use.
